DataElement.preferredName: Diagnostic Imaging Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Assessment Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value of information related to the  final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of documenting response of solid tumors to treatment using a method of visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

Property.preferredName: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Assessment
Property.preferredDefinition: Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com):The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Assessment Count
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric value of assessments used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.

Concepts.definition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A mathematical element that when added to another number yields the same number; the cardinal number meaning one less than one.
